title: Careers Adviser - Student Futures Team
description:
We are seeking an experienced Careers Adviser to join our dynamic Student Futures team. You will provide high-quality careers guidance to undergraduate and postgraduate students across all disciplines, delivering one-to-one appointments, group workshops, and employer engagement activities.

Key responsibilities:
• Deliver impartial careers information, advice and guidance
• Develop and deliver engaging workshops and presentations
• Build relationships with employers and manage recruitment activities
• Contribute to the development of innovative careers programmes
• Maintain accurate records and contribute to service evaluation

The ideal candidate will have a relevant qualification (QCG, NVQ Level 6 or equivalent) and experience of working in careers guidance within higher education.

title: Head of Employability and Enterprise
description:
An exciting opportunity has arisen to lead our Employability and Enterprise service. Reporting to the Director of Student Services, you will be responsible for developing and implementing a strategic vision for employability across the university.

Key responsibilities:
• Provide strategic leadership for the employability service
• Manage a team of careers advisers and enterprise coordinators
• Develop partnerships with employers and industry bodies
• Design and deliver innovative employability programmes
• Monitor and report on key performance indicators
• Manage budgets and resources effectively

We are looking for an inspirational leader with significant experience in careers and employability within higher education, excellent strategic thinking skills, and a track record of successful team management.

title: Employability Coordinator - Business School
description:
Join our Business School team as an Employability Coordinator. You will work with staff and students to embed employability throughout the curriculum and enhance graduate outcomes.

Key activities include:
• Supporting academic staff with employability curriculum development
• Coordinating employer engagement activities and events
• Managing internship and placement programmes
• Analysing graduate outcomes data
• Creating employability resources and materials

Ideal for someone with experience in employability or careers work, strong project management skills, and knowledge of the business and management sector.

title: Senior Careers Consultant (International Students)
description:
We have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Careers Consultant specializing in supporting international students. You will design and deliver targeted careers support for our diverse international student community.

Responsibilities:
• Provide specialist one-to-one careers guidance to international students
• Develop workshops addressing visa regulations, UK job market, and global careers
• Build partnerships with employers who welcome international graduates
• Create resources tailored to international student needs
• Train and mentor junior team members

Essential: QCG or equivalent qualification, experience supporting international students, knowledge of visa regulations and the international graduate job market.

title: Digital Content Creator - Careers Service
description:
Looking for a creative individual to develop engaging digital content for our Careers Service. You'll create videos, podcasts, social media content, and online resources to support student career development.

Key tasks:
• Produce video content including employer interviews and career tips
• Manage social media channels and create engaging posts
• Design infographics and digital resources
• Coordinate podcast series featuring alumni and employers
• Monitor analytics and optimize content strategy

Ideal candidate will have experience in digital content creation, knowledge of social media platforms, and an interest in career development and employability.

title: Placement Officer - Engineering
description:
The Engineering Faculty is seeking a Placement Officer to coordinate and support our year-in-industry placement programme.

You will:
• Recruit employer partners and negotiate placement opportunities
• Support students through the placement application process
• Conduct placement visits and maintain employer relationships
• Manage placement documentation and compliance
• Organize placement preparation workshops

This role requires excellent relationship management skills, attention to detail, and ideally some knowledge of the engineering sector. Previous experience in placement coordination or employer engagement is desirable.

title: Enterprise Development Officer
description:
Join our award-winning Enterprise team to support student entrepreneurship and innovation. You will help students develop their business ideas and create successful start-ups.

Key responsibilities:
• Deliver one-to-one business coaching to student entrepreneurs
• Design and run enterprise workshops and bootcamps
• Manage the student start-up incubator programme
• Source funding opportunities and support grant applications
• Organize networking events with entrepreneurs and investors

We're looking for someone with business experience, coaching skills, and a passion for supporting young entrepreneurs. Experience of start-ups or small business development is highly desirable.

title: Careers Adviser (Part-time)
description:
We are looking for an experienced Careers Adviser to join our team on a part-time basis (0.6 FTE). You will provide careers guidance to students across all disciplines and contribute to our programme of careers events and activities.

Essential requirements:
• Recognized careers guidance qualification (Level 6 Diploma or equivalent)
• Experience of one-to-one careers guidance
• Knowledge of the graduate labor market
• Excellent communication skills

This is a great opportunity for someone looking for flexible working arrangements while making a real difference to student outcomes.

title: Associate Director (Service Engagement & Strategic Projects)
description:
The Associate Director (Service Engagement & Strategic Projects) is a key member of KC&E’s senior leadership team, providing strategic oversight of the Service Engagement & Strategic Projects function. This role is instrumental in enabling the success of KC&E and its sibling functions, Careers Education & Faculty Partnerships and Employer Engagement & Work-Based Learning, by leading the infrastructure, support, and initiatives that underpin our collective work. This includes service operations, marketing and communications, digital education, student voice, and strategic programmes.

We are looking for an individual who shares our aspirations and our values, who is comfortable working strategically and operationally, who understands how to deliver support and services to students and other end-users, and who is equipped to work in a high volume, complex and fast-paced environment.
